alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Middlesex; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Somerset; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 4:32PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Ocean, Mercer, north central Burlington, southern Somerset, southwestern Monmouth, Middlesex and southeastern Bucks Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 432 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Belle Mead to near Tullytown. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Trenton, New Brunswick, Perth Amboy, Somerset, Edison, Old Bridge, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, Sayreville, North Brunswick, Manalapan, Ewing, Princeton, Manville, Jamesburg, Hightstown, Bordentown, Cranbury, Pennington and Yardley. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 7 and 12. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 19. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 56 and 75. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4, and between mile markers 10 and 11. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 122 and 130. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southern, central, northern and northwestern New Jersey...and southeastern Pennsylvania.

area.areaDesc: Mercer; Middlesex; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Somerset; Western Monmouth
